news_header: If the Constitutional Court upholds the impeachment case against South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol, he will be suspended and new elections will be held within 60 days.
news_original_title: Etelä-Korean Yoon mahdollisesti virkasyytekäsittelynsä viimeisessä kuulemisessa
news_text: Yoon attended what may be his final hearing on Thursday, which included consultations with intelligence and security authorities. The court's decision is anticipated to be unanimous in favor of impeachment, according to legal experts. Yoon previously declared a state of emergency, which was annulled by Parliament, raising questions about its constitutionality. Additionally, Yoon faces separate insurrection charges that will lead to a criminal trial within six months, regardless of his presidential immunity.
